Title: Digital marketing communication for freelancer job
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yunus, U., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ananda, R.A., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Compared to a year ago, the number of working people increased by 2.99 million people, while unemployment decreased by 40 thousand people. The XYZ web based in Indonesia has the most freelancers today with more than 300, 000 freelancers. The services needed are also varied, such as website development, design and multimedia, marketing, writing, and other fields. The research focus is how digital marketing communication is done by the XYZ web. The research used descriptive qualitative method that inquiry approach useful for exploring and understanding a central phenomenon. The result showed that in supporting digital marketing communications, XYZ web uses the website that the important roles for companies engaged in digital. Freelancers who get trusted labels and verified labels, will get one of the advantages of being on the front sheet compared to freelancers who do not yet have both labels. The conclusion is digital marketing communication activities can run effectively by utilizing a simple website platform and making the website visitors comfortable. © 2020 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Commerce; Information management; Multimedia services; Websites; Digital marketing; Indonesia; Qualitative method; Research focus; Web based; Web use; Working people; Marketing

Authors: Suherman S., Ananda R., Pinem M.
Title: Environmental Sensor Assessment for a Light Quadcopter Drone
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Materials Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Electrical Engineering Department, Universitas Sumatera Utara, Medan, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suherman, S., Electrical Engineering Department, Universitas Sumatera Utara, Medan, Indonesia; Ananda, R., Electrical Engineering Department, Universitas Sumatera Utara, Medan, Indonesia; Pinem, M., Electrical Engineering Department, Universitas Sumatera Utara, Medan, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper presented drone design and environmental sensor assessment. The assessment was conducted for temperature and pressure. The measurements were performed offline and online. Offline measurement was by locating drone inside a controlled chamber, while online measurement was when drone is flying. Assessment shows that there were significant error differences in temperature, where offline drone exerted only 0.75% error, but online drone produced 6.23% error. Error increases as temperature increases. Pressure assessment exerted a slight error different between offline and online drone, 0.16% and 0.17%. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Funding Text 1: This research has been supported by TALENTA USU research grant 2020.

Authors: Suryana A., Ananda R., Maulana T.R., Rizal M.
Title: Rice Controller Using Half Bridge Load Cell and NodeMCU ESP8266 in Rice Dispenser
Source title: 5th International Conference on Computing Engineering and Design, ICCED 2019
Affiliations: Nusa Putra University, Electrical Engineering Dept, Sukabumi, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suryana, A., Nusa Putra University, Electrical Engineering Dept, Sukabumi, Indonesia; Ananda, R., Nusa Putra University, Electrical Engineering Dept, Sukabumi, Indonesia; Maulana, T.R., Nusa Putra University, Electrical Engineering Dept, Sukabumi, Indonesia; Rizal, M., Nusa Putra University, Electrical Engineering Dept, Sukabumi, Indonesia
Abstract: Rice is a staple food in many cultures. Instead, rice is a staple food for about half of the world's population. Some studies show that white rice consumption contributes greatly to the development of type 2 diabetes. Type-2 and type-1 diabetes is caused by obesity which requires tracking carbohydrate intake accurately. Especially in Indonesia, the calculation of the Carbohydrate Adequacy Number (CAN) refers to the regulation of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Indonesia Number 75 of 2013 concerning Recommended Dietary Allowances (RDA). To fulfill daily consumption needs of carbohydrates so as not to overdo it, in this study rice dispensers were made to be able to regulate rice consumption needs according to the daily Carbohydrate Adequacy Number (CAN). Rice Dispenser is made using hardware from four half-bridge load cells, HX711 as ADC module, microcontroller NodeMCU and ESP8266 which functions as data communication via WiFi that is connected to online software. On the server side as monitoring and control in consuming rice every day is regulated through the application in real time. From the results of testing both hardware and software, rice dispensers that have been made can work well. The remote control also functions well and in measuring the mass of rice, rice dispensers can measure accurately. Likewise, when removing rice from a rice dispenser it works automatically and is scheduled by setting on the server side. As for testing, the average error values obtained from the measurement results obtained are 1.45 and 6.6. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: carbohydrate; load cell; NodeMCU; rice dispenser; server
Index Keywords: Carbohydrates; Computer hardware; Controllers; Remote control; Software testing; Well testing; Average errors; Data-communication; Hardware and software; Monitoring and control; On-line softwares; Recommended dietary allowances; Server sides; Type-2 diabetes; Dispensers
